text: Hello all! My name is Brandon, and I am brand new to Julia programming. I would like to add Julia to my novice Python data science skills. This looks like a lovely community, and I am extremely excited to be here. To get started, what training material/courses would you all recommend for novice Julia developers? Thanks in advance for your help!

elements.text: Hello all! My name is Brandon, and I am brand new to Julia programming. I would like to add Julia to my novice Python data science skills. This looks like a lovely community, and I am extremely excited to be here. To get started, what training material/courses would you all recommend for novice Julia developers? Thanks in advance for your help!

text: Really depends on what you want to do. The manual is a good starting point and a useful read, <https://juliaacademy.com/> has some courses for specific applications (data science, ML etc), the Think Julia book is also often mentioned as a good resource for beginners

attachments.title: JuliaAcademy
attachments.text: Prepared by core Julia developers in collaboration with Julia Computing. Learn more about Julia at <https://julialang.org>.

elements.text: Really depends on what you want to do. The manual is a good starting point and a useful read,
has some courses for specific applications (data science, ML etc), the Think Julia book is also often mentioned as a good resource for beginners
